intro: Acinos baumgartenii, commonly known as the Sierra acino, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments, thriving at high elevations. Its leaves are usually gray-green and covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss. The small yellow flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
